NYX

The night can, from one moment to another, give way to fiction. It is a space of fantasies and disappearance that evokes insecurity and nothingness in the collective imagination ; however, romantic poets have also sung and extolled her for her dreamlike power. The film presents a collection of video recordings that form a repertoire of the nocturnal world, a composition without conventional narration scenes whose sequences are piled up like stratas, in plateaux. The assembly of recordings filmed at different times and places draws a sensitive and unachieved portrait of the night — sometimes abstract, poetic or threatening. The project, started in 2015, has no end. It aims to take the opposite of a conventional narrative film, that is : a beginning, a duration, events, an epilogue. The filmic object continues to rise over the years, by superimposing the memory layers of sound and image, like a slippery surface evolving intuitively. The night thus remains a kind of organized disorder which is familiar to us, as much as foreign — a territory where the forms are concealing, as much that they reveal themselves. Documenting the night disrupts a mute and indomitable equilibrium, from which we pulls the elements out of their sleep — a sleep which, would we believe, could be eternal.
